bug.author: leo-p
bug.description:
Specifying a destination for the classifier.save() method results in an error. <denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "demo_AutoGluon.py", line 24, in <module> classifier.save('saved_model') File "xxx/site-packages/autogluon/task/image_classification/classifier.py", line 61, in save save(self.state_dict(), checkpoint) File "xxx/site-packages/autogluon/task/image_classification/classifier.py", line 51, in state_dict destination = OrderedDict() NameError: name 'OrderedDict' is not defined </denchmark-code>
This seems to be due to the fact that OrderedDict is used but never imported in classifier.py see here. This can easily be fixed by adding from collections import OrderedDict.

comments.comment: Merged into mainline, thanks for your contribution!
